result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronny Rydell Greer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered restitution in the amount of $3685.00 to US Bank.  
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.
Court waived all other court costs due to amount of restitution imposed.
Court ordered a payment plan of $50.00 per month commencing 1/15/2016 to be paid on the same date each month until paid in full.  Any missed payment and the total amount becomes due and owing and to convert to a  civil judgment.
With 132 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronny Rydell Greer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   
Court ordered defendant to serve 132 days in the House of Correction, with 132 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court ordered restitution in the amount of $3685.00 to US Bank.  
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.
Court waived all other court costs due to amount of restitution imposed
Court ordered a payment plan of $50.00 per month commencing 1/15/2016 to be paid on the same date each month until paid in full.  Any missed payment and the total amount becomes due and owing and to convert to a  civil judgment.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:
Victim Impact Statement
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Ronny Rydell Greer in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Filed, original amended information filed 11/16/2015; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to Theft, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(d) and (3)(a)  , a Class A misdemeanor.
Same bail conditions as previously ordered.

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court, defendant Ronny Rydell Greer not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  AMENDED INFORMATION, filed and to be addressed at the next court hearing.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 11/2/2015.  Bench warrant in court tickler file.  Case adjourned for Return on bench warrant in Br. 19 on 11/16/2015 at 8:30 am.  Email notice provided to State and public defender office.

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Attorney Voss states the defendant is in custody in Brown County.  Court orders the Milwaukee County bench warrant remain active.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court.  Maureen Ami Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant fails to appear for the bail bond hearing on a violation.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court does not forfeit any bail at this time.   Case remains calendared for 8/21/15 at 8:30 am plea and sentencing.
Justice Point Report, filed
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed. Parties notified to select a date to address the violation. Bail hearing scheduled for 08/07/2015 at 8:30am.

Defendant Ronny Rydell Greer in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Patrick Anderson for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.  Case remains calendared for plea and sentencing in Branch 19 on 08/21/2015 at 8:30am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Defendant missed office visit.  Parties contacted to schedule bail review.  Bail review scheduled for 7/10/15  at 8:30 am in Branch 22.

Defendant Ronny Rydell Greer in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.  Case remains calendared for plea and sentencing 08/21/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 19.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Positive drug test.  Bail review scheduled for 06/19/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 22.

Defendant Ronny Rydell Greer in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Letter from Atty Voss that a discovery demand was sent to the district attorney's office received and filed.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court orders $500 signature bond.  All conditions of bail previously set remain.

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court, defendant Ronny Rydell Greer not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel and bail review.  Defense requests  more time to review case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Ronny Rydell Greer not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waived bail/bond hearing.  Due to a breakdown in communication with client, defense requested to withdraw. Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.   Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Ronny Rydell Greer not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Ronny Rydell Greer in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Ronny Rydell Greer in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court.  Patrick Anderson for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE. Defendant was in custody in Ozaukee County, and due to conflicting court dates and was not produced.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Ronny Rydell Greer in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  
Defendant Ronny Rydell Greer in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
